bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, February 5, 1899

div1.p: Lazear is glad to hear that his mother and Martha Houston are enjoying each other. He informs Sweitzer that Mabel Lazear has gone into labor.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, February 5, 1899
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE. Feb 5, 99
My dear Mother
div1.p:
I am glad to hear that you
and Mrs. Houston are going around and
seeing things. I notice that there are a
number of good things on at the opera for
this week. “Nathan Hole” played by Nat Goodman
has been praised in the Times and I have no doubt
the “White Horse Tavern” will be worth seeing.
Today Mabel has signs of the beginning of labor
and I would not be surprised if it took place
inside of twenty four hours. I shall telegraph
at once and I hardly think it will be
necessary to say anything to Mrs Houston
until the telegram comes. It might make
her uneasy. I shall have the nurse
stay in the house tonight. Everything is
ready. I put up the iron bedstead this
morning.
How do you like my new paper?
Give my love to Mrs Houston

I have just finished my article on the
Plague. The two papers will bring me about
$110.
